title: Naming Conventions
text: Next we are going to talk about naming conventions Naming conventions basically means we are trying to name our variables Like when a child is born and we have to decide his new name then the priest gives some rules that the name should start with Ra or Sir and then we decide the name of the child Similarly, C++ also has some naming conventions It's not that we can name any variable The first rule of naming variables is that we have to name the variable That is, the name of our variable i.e. our identifier that should start with an underscore or any letter It should start with any letter of English or with an underscore So, if I am making a variable Let's suppose I have made a variable age So I can write int age is equal to 25 This is a valid name because it is starting with an English letter But if I wanted I could have written underscore age This is also a valid name But if I want to write one age This is not a valid name because it starts with a digit So this is not a valid name This cannot be a name of a variable The second rule says The name can only contain uppercase and lowercase English letters So, it means all the letters can come from capital A to capital Z All the letters from small a to small z can come from English All the digits can come from zero to nine But the digit cannot come in the beginning And underscore can come So, any other special symbols like &, at the rate dollar We cannot keep any such symbol in the name of a variable So, in the name of a variable only these are allowed characters And the third rule says It must not be a keyword Now, what is a keyword? In C++ or any programming language There are some reserved words We can call it a dictionary of our programming language In which every word has a fixed meaning Similarly, C++ has a dictionary which has 90 plus words which we call keywords And these words have a fixed meaning We cannot use them like a variable So, keywords have a special meaning for the compiler So, for the compiler, it has a special meaning You cannot change that meaning In C++, we have all these keywords We do not need to remember these keywords at all Because the most frequently used keywords will help us to write C++ code So, we will remember them slowly So, no one will ask you to write 90 keywords in the interview It will never happen I am just showing you these keywords for your reference We do not need to remember them For example, we will see some words which we have already used Like int is a keyword It is not that you will keep the name of any variable as int It does not make sense to write int int is equal to 5 This will confuse the compiler We are talking about integer twice So, int is a keyword Similarly, return of main function is also a keyword We cannot keep the name of any variable Similarly, we have many different keywords In fact, if we talk about data types we will see many data types in this list So, in our naming convention the name of our variable should not be a reserved keyword Otherwise, we will get an error Let's see an example in code For example, I have written some variable int return is equal to 5 So, in return there is a special color in VS code We have got an error Expected an identifier Return is a keyword It is not an identifier Still, we will try to run the code We will get an error Expected unqualified id Return is a keyword So, C++ has unqualified it So, we cannot use return as a valid identifier

chunks.title: Naming Conventions
chunks.text: Next we are going to talk about naming conventions

chunks.title: Naming Conventions
chunks.text: Naming conventions basically means

chunks.title: Naming Conventions
chunks.text: we are trying to name our variables

chunks.title: Naming Conventions
chunks.text: Like when a child is born

chunks.title: Naming Conventions
chunks.text: and we have to decide his new name

chunks.title: Naming Conventions
chunks.text: then the priest gives some rules

chunks.title: Naming Conventions
chunks.text: that the name should start with Ra

chunks.title: Naming Conventions
chunks.text: or Sir

chunks.title: Naming Conventions
chunks.text: and then we decide the name of the child

chunks.title: Naming Conventions
chunks.text: Similarly, C++ also has some naming conventions

chunks.title: Naming Conventions
chunks.text: It's not that we can name any variable

chunks.title: Naming Conventions
chunks.text: The first rule of naming variables is

chunks.title: Naming Conventions
chunks.text: that we have to name the variable

chunks.title: Naming Conventions
chunks.text: That is, the name of our variable

chunks.title: Naming Conventions
chunks.text: i.e. our identifier

chunks.title: Naming Conventions
chunks.text: that should start with an underscore

chunks.title: Naming Conventions
chunks.text: or any letter

chunks.title: Naming Conventions
chunks.text: It should start with any letter of English

chunks.title: Naming Conventions
chunks.text: or with an underscore

chunks.title: Naming Conventions
chunks.text: So, if I am making a variable

chunks.title: Naming Conventions
chunks.text: Let's suppose I have made a variable age

chunks.title: Naming Conventions
chunks.text: So I can write int age

chunks.title: Naming Conventions
chunks.text: is equal to 25

chunks.title: Naming Conventions
chunks.text: This is a valid name because it is starting with an English letter

chunks.title: Naming Conventions
chunks.text: But if I wanted

chunks.title: Naming Conventions
chunks.text: I could have written underscore age

chunks.title: Naming Conventions
chunks.text: This is also a valid name

chunks.title: Naming Conventions
chunks.text: But if I want to write one age

chunks.title: Naming Conventions
chunks.text: This is not a valid name

chunks.title: Naming Conventions
chunks.text: because it starts with a digit

chunks.title: Naming Conventions
chunks.text: So this is not a valid name

chunks.title: Naming Conventions
chunks.text: This cannot be a name of a variable

chunks.title: Naming Conventions
chunks.text: The second rule says

chunks.title: Naming Conventions
chunks.text: The name can only contain uppercase and lowercase English letters

chunks.title: Naming Conventions
chunks.text: So, it means

chunks.title: Naming Conventions
chunks.text: all the letters can come from capital A to capital Z

chunks.title: Naming Conventions
chunks.text: All the letters from small a to small z

chunks.title: Naming Conventions
chunks.text: can come from English

chunks.title: Naming Conventions
chunks.text: All the digits can come from zero to nine

chunks.title: Naming Conventions

chunks.title: Naming Conventions

chunks.text: like &, at the rate

chunks.title: Naming Conventions
chunks.text: dollar

chunks.title: Naming Conventions
chunks.text: We cannot keep any such symbol in the name of a variable

chunks.title: Naming Conventions
chunks.text: So, in the name of a variable

chunks.title: Naming Conventions
chunks.text: only these are allowed characters

chunks.title: Naming Conventions
chunks.text: And the third rule says

chunks.title: Naming Conventions
chunks.text: It must not be a keyword

chunks.text: Now, what is a keyword?
